definition: tight/strict/close at hand/near/urgent/tense/hard up/short of money/to tighten

sentences.english: Two Italian regions, Lombardy and Emilia Romagna, have already requested that a state of emergency be declared.
sentences.chinese: 意大利的倫巴第和羅馬涅兩個地區已經發布緊急狀態。

sentences.english: To that end, we believe that the emergency law should be lifted.
sentences.chinese: 爲了這個目的，我們認爲緊急狀態法案應該解除。

sentences.english: We downgraded the military alert from emergency to standby.
sentences.chinese: 我們把軍事戒備從緊急狀態降至待命狀態。

sentences.english: The government has declared a state of emergency around the airports.
sentences.chinese: 泰國政府已經宣佈曼谷周圍的機場地區進入緊急狀態。

sentences.english: The decree banned public demonstrations and all independent newscasts.
sentences.chinese: 緊急狀態令禁止公共示威和所有獨立新聞廣播。

sentences.english: The state of emergency was decreed only in Tbilisi, Nogaideli added.
sentences.chinese: 諾蓋德里補充說，只在第比利斯實行國家緊急狀態。

sentences.english: The governor declared a state of emergency.
On Thursday Prime Minister Somchai Wongsawat declared a state of emergency at the airports.
sentences.chinese: 星期四泰國總理頌猜宣佈機場地區進入緊急狀態。

definition: Kanting township in Pingtung County 屏東縣|屏东县[Ping2 dong1 Xian4], Taiwan
to swear the oath of office
(of a pendulum) to stop swinging/(of work, production, activities etc) to come to a halt/to be suspended/to be canceled/shutdown/(sports) lockout
